body:
Thanks for the issue, we will take it into consideration! Our team of engineers is busy working on many types of features, please give us time to get back to you.

Feature requests that require more discussion may be closed. Read more about our [feature request process](https://forem.dev/foremteam/internal-rfc-process-and-forem-dev-discussions-3gl4) on forem.dev.

To our amazing contributors: issues labeled `type: bug` are always up for grabs, but for feature requests, please wait until we add a `ready for dev` before starting to work on it.

To claim an issue to work on, please leave a comment. If you've claimed the issue and need help, please ping @forem/oss. The OSS Community Manager or the engineers on OSS rotation will follow up.

For full info on how to contribute, please check out our [contributors guide](https://github.com/forem/forem/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md).

I was going to pick this up, but I can't reproduce it.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22390758/134821192-5819ee35-c374-49c2-9dd4-b70e419a9357.mov

I see. So in your video the post isn't deleted, it's unpublished. I'm guessing it's still on the Reading List because it's your own post and you can view your own unpublished posts. Will wait for someone to confirm the expected behaviour. If this is a bug I'd be happy to take it on.

Thanks for testing this @metamoni . I'll try to test it out with a coworker tomorrow so we can see if they save my post and I delete my post if it will disappear from their reading list. I think your assumption about why @Tronic247 is still seeing the post in their reading list is correct but will try to confirm and let you know!

rename.from: Reading list doesen't update when a post deleted
rename.to: Reading list doesen't update when a post unpublished (Deleted also ?)

body: Oh sorry.. It's unpublished. I didn't know I can delete a post..

I've confirmed that an unpublished article (not mine) added to my reading list cannot be archived.

> I recently started cleaning up my Reading List on DEV.to and noticed that one particular article kept coming back after I Archived it. I clicked the link to see if I could remove it from the article page, but am getting a 404. The article now seems to be stuck on my Reading List.

The article was here ... [GitSheet - my git cheatsheet](https://dev.to/myrtle/gitsheet-my-git-cheatsheet-4o18)

I believe this issue should be reopened as it is an existing issue.
Reopening for @bob-fornal - and confirming it's an unpublished post that is causing this issue in Bob's reading list.

issue.title: Ensuring reading list excludes unpublished articles

labels.name: PR: merged
labels.description: bot applied label for PR's that are merged

license.name: GNU Affero General Public License v3.0

issue.body:
## What type of PR is this? (check all applicable)

- [x] Bug Fix

## Description

Prior to this commit, if a given user adds an article to their reading
list then the author unpublishes the article, the article remains in the
reading list.  When the given user would then "click" on the now
unpublished article, they would get a 404 Not Found notice.

With this commit, we now exclude unpublished articles from the search
results for the reading list.

This should also address the issue of attempting to archive the reading
list item (because it won't be visible in the listing).

One of the behaviors that is expected is if, in the above scenario, the
author again publishes the article, that article will again "appear" on
the reading list for the given user.

## Related Tickets & Documents

Closes #14796

## QA Instructions, Screenshots, Recordings

To test this in the UI:

- Sign in
- Create and publish an article
- Add it to your reading list
- Unpublish the article
- Revisit your reading list.

### UI accessibility concerns?

None.

## Added/updated tests?

- [x] Yes

## [Forem core team only] How will this change be communicated?

- [X] This change does not need to be communicated, and this is why not: when we merge the PR, the issue will close
